result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy A. ESKRA Sr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Deliver Schedule II Narcotic within 1000 feet of school (Oxycodone) [Modifiers: Possession with Intent to Deliver/Distribute a Controlled Substance On or Near a School], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain fulltime employment if physically able to do so - at the agent's discretion.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Take all medications as prescribed and in prescribed doses and use only one doctor and one pharmacist.

timeConds.notes:
Under the Huber Law.  Court authorizes release for child care purposes.

Additional three (3) months jail, under the Huber Law, stayed and to be imposed at the agent's discretion and upon order of the court.

records.addlTxt:
NO CONTEST plea entered to count 1, deliver Oxycodone within 1000 feet of school as repeater.  Convicted.
The State moves to dismiss and read in counts 2 and 3.  Motion granted.
Sentencing is set for 07-07-15 at 11:30 a.m.
The Court orders the defendant to submit to a DNA sample.
Minutes.

Attorney Hoff requests an adjournment.
Plea date/scheduling conference is set for 06-08-15 at 3:00 p.m.
Minutes.

Settlement Conference Summary.
Plea hearing is set for 05-20-2015 at 2:00 p.m., Br. 1.

Settlement Conference Summary.
Settlement conference with District Attorney is reset to 03-12-15 at 1:30 p.m.
Defendant's Discovery Demand.
State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.

Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 1 for trial.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed.  Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty pleas entered.  Jury calendar.
Settlement conference with District Attorney is set for 02-20-15 at 11:30 a.m.
Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.
Information.
Minutes.
Philip Hoff, through Public Defender.
Preliminary hearing reset to 02-04-15 at 2:00 p.m.
Order for Withdrawal of Counsel of Record.

Defense counsel has discovered a conflict of interest and moves to withdraw as counsel.  Motion granted.  Defendant waives the statutory time period within which a preliminary hearing must be held.  Preliminary hearing reset to 01-28-15 at 3:00 p.m.   
Notice.
Minutes.
Adam Snavely, through Public Defender.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing is set for 01-14-15 at 2:00 p.m.  
Minutes.

Defendant in custody on arrest warrant.  The matter is continued for an initial appearance on 01-05-15 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $1,500.00 recognizance bond with the condition that he have no contact with Terry Johnson.  Bail furnished and the defendant is released from custody.
Arrest warrant with service of officer thereon.
